meanings.definition: The act of baptizing someone again.
meanings.sent1: The rebaptism of the man was a joyful event for the whole community.
meanings.sent2: In some religions, rebaptism is considered unnecessary.
meanings.sent3: The rebaptism ceremony turned into a water fight, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her rebaptism into the faith was like a fresh start in life.
meanings.sent5: The rebaptism was so pure and cleansing, it felt like a new beginning.

meanings.definition: The practice of baptizing someone who has already been baptized.
meanings.sent1: The church's rebaptism policy caused some controversy among the members.
meanings.sent2: Rebaptism is not accepted in all denominations.
meanings.sent3: The rebaptism tradition started as a practical joke but became a serious custom.
meanings.sent4: His rebaptism was like going through the motions without any true belief.
meanings.sent5: The rebaptism ritual felt redundant to many attendees.
